title: No Types on ESLint plugin

labels.name: Linting
labels.description: Related to `next lint` or ESLint with Next.js.

body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/search?q=%40next%2Feslint-plugin-next+%40ts-expect-error+path%3A*eslint.config.*&type=code

### To Reproduce

`import next from '@next/eslint-plugin-next'`

### Current vs. Expected behavior

shouldn't be getting a warning. Also it should be documented how I can import the nextjs plugin if I have a separate config for eslint outside of the next config file - https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/configuration-files

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: darwin
  Arch: x64
  Version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.4.0: Fri Apr 11 18:28:23 PDT 2025; root:xnu-11417.101.15~117/RELEASE_X86_64
  Available memory (MB): 32768
  Available CPU cores: 16
Binaries:
  Node: 24.2.0
  npm: 11.3.0
  Yarn: 1.22.22
  pnpm: 10.12.4
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.3.3 // There is a newer version (15.3.4) available, upgrade recommended! 
  eslint-config-next: 15.3.3
  react: 19.1.0
  react-dom: 19.1.0
  typescript: 5.8.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
 âš  There is a newer version (15.3.4) available, upgrade recommended!
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Linting

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local)

### Additional context

How can I set it up for now? I tried this but I don't see react warnings about insufficient dependencies on `useMemo` for example.
```ts
import eslint from '@eslint/js'
import tseslint from 'typescript-eslint'
// @ts-expect-error no types here 
import next from '@next/eslint-plugin-next'

export default tseslint.config(
  eslint.configs.recommended,
  tseslint.configs.recommended,
  next.flatConfig.recommended, 
  next.flatConfig.coreWebVitals
)
```
I did various attempts trying to import `from 'eslint-config-next'` but nothing worked
